title: Per capita consumption of tree nuts in the U.S. 2000 to 2018
summary: Overall Per capita consumption in pounds has increased over the Year.

Per capita consumption in pounds is slightly increasing from 2006 to 2007, roughly constant from 2007 to 2011, slightly increasing from 2011 to 2012, roughly constant from 2012 to 2015, and finally gradually increasing from 2015 to 2017.
The most drastic increase took place within the Year 2015 and 2016.
The highest Per capita consumption in pounds, of value 5.0 was reached at Year 2017
Minimum Per capita consumption in pounds about 3.3 was reached at Year 2006
